title: Malcolm II of Scotland
summary: Malcolm II (Gaelic: Máel Coluim mac Cináeda; c. 954 – 25 November 1034)[2] was King of the Scots from 1005 until his death.[3] He was a son of King Kenneth II; the Prophecy of Berchán says that his mother was a woman of Leinster and refers to him as Forranach, "the Destroyer".[4]
